DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to evaluate the impact of the use of a quick diagnostic test of infection with RSV and influenza virus on the assumption of clinical responsibility of the children consulting at the Paediatric Emergency Unit.
DOC.brief_title: TGV:Use of the Quick Diagnostic Test of the Influenza and the Infection With RSV by the Paediatric Emergency Unit
DOC.criteria: Age less than 5 years Isolated fever and/or Infection of the higher air routes (congestive otitis, feverish rhinitides, tracheitis or laryngitis) and/or infection of the lower air routes (cough, pneumonia, bronchitis, asthma) Signed consent form Evocative clinical of a urinary and/or bacterial infection Purulent acute otitis media Typical acute bronchiolitis Suspicion of acute lobar pneumonia Acute gastroenteritis Anginas Serious chronic respiratory pathology Other infection whose etiologic viral diagnosis is established Congenital or acquired immunizing deficits Congenital cardiopathy
